using max martins melodic math write a song that fits these keywords:    Alt-Pop, Dance-Pop, Electropop Trap, Tech House deadpan, minimalistic, dark, female vocalist, rhythmic, playful, ominous, sarcastic, quirky, boastful, sombre, nocturnal, mellow, apathetic, sensual, atmospheric. please follow these guidelines: 
Verses
4 Lines per Verse: Typically, verses have four lines.
8-12 Syllables per Line: Aim for 8 to 12 syllables per line to create a rhythmic and balanced flow.
Pre-Chorus
2-4 Lines per Pre-Chorus: Pre-choruses usually have fewer lines.
6-10 Syllables per Line: Slightly shorter lines than the verses to build anticipation.
Chorus
4 Lines per Chorus: The chorus often mirrors the verse in line count.
8-12 Syllables per Line: Similar to the verse, maintaining symmetry and balance.
Bridge
2-4 Lines per Bridge: The bridge can vary but usually is concise.
6-10 Syllables per Line: Keeping it tight and impactful.

name: Medical and Health Inquiries
examples: do colds always start with a sore throat?

My girlfriend Lisa who is 22, a65cm and 45 kg, had a cut at her right hip some weeks ago. After about 10 days it looked healed. She had some pain in her right hip and pelvis, but she waited to go away. Yesterday her leg was a bit swollen and late afternoon she was tired, and we went to sleep. Today morning her leg was swollen like a balloon and discolored from her pelvise down. It was numb, and she had high fever. We went to the ER, but before we arrived, she went unconcuious.She was transfered to the ICU immediately and tests were taken. After the initial results arrived, they moved her to the OR immediately. Her doctors stated: The medical team is an orthopedic, a spine surgeon, and am infection disease specialist. She has osteomyelitis in her thigh, hip and almost all of her right pelvis. The infection is caused by staphylococcus. The infected bones, in her pelvis, hip and thigh, and the right leg is biologically destroyed, lost,  already and non viable. The only priority, is to stop spreading the infection. Limb salvage, aesthetics, or neurological function considerations will be ignored. She can bear only one surgery yet. They have to make an ultimate long term solution in this one opportunity. The surgery will be radical with extreme safety margins. Nothing will be left within the margins range. What we can expect? Please direct answers without ambiguity. How certain is the amputation? Given that "The infected bones, in her pelvis, hip and thigh, and the right leg is biologically destroyed already and non viable." What extreme safety margins means in centimeters, instead of common margins, in her case, where aggressive ostomyelitis, staphylococcus, and whole infectious bone structures are present? What these extreme safety margins could mean in her case regarding her tiny stature, and the staement of "Nothing will be left within the margins range."? So her spine could be involved, thus the spine surgeon? What levels of her spine could be involved in the surgery? with percentages please. Are these estimates calculated with the safety margins? I think it is crucial with her tiny stature. These are not reflecting 10-15cm  or more minimum safety margins. Or am I wrong? Is this means she would be certainly a complete paraplegic? So what are the most likely affected levels with percentages, in calculating in the statements of "limb salvage, aesthetics, or function considerations will be ignored" and "Nothing will be left within the margins range."? So how certain is the amputation, complete paraplegia, or even quadriplegia? What braces she will need after the surgery? Is she will prone to scoliosis? So she will need 24/7 bracing, even if most parts of her spinal column is spared? Or because the most of her spinal column will be resected? So from her remaining pelvis to her head she will need a brace, to provide anatomical support to her torso? So what is the most likely SCI level in her case?

My girlfriend Lisa who is 22 had a cut in her right hip, some 2 months ago. She mentioned that her hip is aching, despite it looked ok, it was recovered in about 10 days. Today we wake up, that she had 40C fever, and shaking. Her right hip, pelvis, and whole right leg has been swollen like a ballon, and all of her vascularities has been showed under her skin with dark blue or even black color. We went to the ER. when we arrived, she had no feelings in her right leg. She is in the OR now. Her doctor said, based on her MRI, she have an aggressive and widespread osteomyelitis in her thigh, hip, and large portion of the hemipelvis. She needs immediate radical surgery with extreme safety margins, because besides her bones, her tissues has advanced gangrene too. Everything will be excised within the margins. The area and the right leg in biological meanings has been lost, non viable. Based on her blood test, the infection is still somewhat locally fortunately, but samples from the pus showing staphylococcus. The only priority is to prevent the infection further spreading, no matter the consequences. There is no room for assumptions, only swift ultimate long term solution could be successful. Her body can not bear multiple surgeries yet, this one opportunity has tolve this critical situation. Aesthetics, limb salvage and neurological functionality is ignored in her case. They don’t have the option to try to save any bony structures. The medical staff will include orthopedic surgeon, spine surgeon, and infectious disease specialist. What we can expect? My girlfriend Lisa who is 22, woke up with numbness from her armpits down. Her diagnosis is: 1. On admission ASIA score below T1 is 0. 2. The patient is awake and fully orientated, Glasgow Coma Score 15, hemodynamically stable. 3. complete Spinal infaction at T1. at least 10-11 hours before admission. 4. Vascular and repair surgery done, 5. necrotic section of the spinal cord and canal totally excised resulting a 3cm gap at T1. 6. Both end of remaining spinal canal is closed above T2 and below C7. 7. ASIA score after a week is still 0. What we can expect? Point by point please. necrotic section of the spinal cord and canal totally excised resulting a 3cm gap at T1. 6. Both end of remaining spinal canal is closed above T2 and below C7.

My 22 years old girlfriend had an accident. Her diagnosis is: "AP radiograph and sagittal CT of the lower thoracic spine. The AP radiograph shows gross lateral misalignment of the spine at T1-T2. The left  rib has stayed with T1, while the right  rib is fractured but has stayed with T2, indicating the severity of the T2 fractures. The sagittal CT shows gross anterior dislocation of T1 over T2 and complete obliteration of the spinal canal, and transection of the spinal cord at T1 with a 5mm gap." What we can expect? Please short, direct, simple, unambigous answer, I am not a doctor. Do not use equivocations. Is she is a complete paraplegic? What she will still can feel, move? So from the top of her armpits down? How she will sit, move, doing daily tasks? So she will need a brace 24/7, to prevent collapsing her torso? What type of brace she will need? CTLSO? HALO? Combined?

Dear Yein,




 In order to facilitate operational and administrative needs, and considering that not all suppliers are willing to establish EFT relations for small purchases, nor can use prepaid card, Petty Cash is required. In addition, we recently leased a third office and are making preparations for its setup and there is ongoing maintenance work in all offices that will require small purchases. 
On a separate note, we cannot reduce the limit of prepaid card as there are certain payments that necessitate its use:
Diplomatic Corps Service Bureau: Due to the budgetary constraints of Uzbek government organizations, they make financial transactions through the Uzbekistan Treasury and personal customer accounts. This prevents them from registering in our ERP system, making the Prepaid Card the only viable option.
Vehicle Maintenance: Our current supplier is unwilling to accept the UNOPS contract, requiring us to use the Prepaid Card for these payments.
The ERP system developers are actively working on resolving the registration issue with the Diplomatic Corps Service Bureau, but until then, the Prepaid Card remains essential for these transactions.
Therefore, finding an alternative payment method for smaller, more frequent purchases is crucial to streamline our office operations.
Please let me know when you're available to discuss this further.

Surprisingly the cookies are very soft, despite the dry to wet ratio being lower than many other keto cookies I've seen, any idea why? The browning and crunch on the edges was good but I'd like them to have a better bite. Here are my other notes: 

- not sweet enough, maybe add ~50g more erythritol
- very soft coming out of the over but seems to holds together well, xanthan gum redundant maybe?
- feels like too much moisture and dense, could use more lupin and can safely add more bamboo fiber as it's undetectable, reduce almond, coconut flour could be removed entirely?
- a bit bitter, ethyl vanillin and too much chocolate is the likely culprit. Try half a bar (40g) next time 
- didn't rise at all, maybe add 1/2 tsp baking soda

Persona:
Emma Thompson is a 42-year-old female Portfolio Manager at Apex Capital Management in New York City, with an MBA from a top-tier business school and CFA designation. With 15+ years of experience in the investment industry, she currently manages a $2 billion equity fund and leads a team of analysts and junior portfolio managers. Emma's primary goals are to consistently outperform market benchmarks, stay ahead of trends, manage risk effectively, improve operational efficiency, and integrate ESG factors into her investment decisions. She relies on real-time market data, in-depth analysis, and alternative data sources, leveraging advanced financial software and AI applications. Emma's data-driven approach combines quantitative analysis with input from her team, balancing short-term opportunities and long-term trends. She faces challenges such as information overload, time constraints, and pressure to deliver consistent returns in a competitive market. Emma values integrity, continuous learning, work-life balance, and innovation in investment strategies. Her ultimate objective is to enhance her fund's performance through a data-driven approach while navigating the complexities of the modern investment landscape.

## A Case Study & Sales Strategy: Reaching $1,000 in Sales from 1,000 True Fans in 2 Weeks.

To reach the objective of generating $1K in total sales from 1,000 True Fans (like Emma aka The Portfolio Manager) in 2 weeks period, starting from 0 audience, we can consider the following strategies and calculate the potential revenue from each:

Lead Magnet:

1. Guide (8 Pages - Mini Guide): Free, so no direct revenue. This acts as an initial hook to attract potential customers.
2. 60 seconds Tutorial Videos: Free, so no direct revenue. These short videos provide valuable content and encourage engagement.

"The $1 Offer" - A Multi-Tiered Approach:

This strategy utilizes a proven method of starting with a low-priced offer to attract a large number of buyers and then increasing the price for subsequent offers.

Phase 1: Initial Offer Launch (Video Sales Letter - VSL)
   - The $1 Offer: Aimed at building trust and initial engagement.
     - Base Offer (64 Pages Guide): Priced at $1. If all 1,000 fans take this offer, this generates $1,000 directly. However, realistically, let's assume a conservative uptake:
       - Assume 200 sales = $200.
* (64 Pages Guide on Transformation Approach and Progressive Journey): $1.00 × XX sales = $XX. This introductory offer serves as a gateway to higher-priced options.  Let's assume we convert 200 potential buyers at this price point. This would generate $200.
(64 Pages Guide on Transformation Approach and Progressive Journey): Introduced at $1.00. 
   - Assuming a conservative 10% conversion rate within the first 5 minutes of the VSL, we get 100 sales (1,000 viewers x 10%).
   - Revenue: $1.00 × 100 sales = $100.


Phase 2: Offer Price Increase (VSL Continues)
   - Within the first 5 minutes of the VSL, let's estimate 20% of the initial buyers convert due to urgency and appeal:
     - 20% of 1,00 = 200 buyers = $xx.
*  Within the first 5 minutes of the VSL, approximately XX (let's say 200) potential buyers took the $1 offer.
(64 Pages Guide): Price increased to $9.99.
   - The remaining 900 viewers continue watching the VSL.
   - Assuming a 20% conversion rate for the $9.99 offer, we get 180 sales (900 viewers x 20%).
   - Revenue: $9.99 × 180 sales = $1798.20.

Phase 3: Offer Price Increase:
   - Standard Offer: After the initial $1 offer, the price increases to $9.99 for those who watched the entire VSL or came in later.
     - Assuming another 27 fans buy at this price:
       - 100 sales at $9.99 = $xx, but we need to scale this back to fit our $1,000 target, so let's adjust:
       - 50 sales at $9.99 = $499.50.
*  The offer price is then raised from $1 to $9.99.
60 Mins Tutorial Videos & Downloadable Materials (Standard Offer): $9.99 
   - Offered to a segment of the initial buyers (e.g., those who engaged most with the VSL or Tier 03).
   - Assuming a 10% conversion rate from the initial 280 buyers, we get 28 sales.
   - Revenue: $9.99 × 28 sales = $279.72.

Phase 4: Advanced Offer:
   - Combination Offer: Including tutorials, materials, and three months of session calls at $297 for highly engaged fans.
     - If we aim for just 1 sale to keep within our target:
       - 1 sale = $297.
* $297 Program (Combination of Base and Standard Offers; including Three Free Months of Session Call Recurring Subscription): 1 customer × $297 = $297. This premium offer targets highly engaged customers seeking a more comprehensive solution. While the initial goal is to reach $1,000, this offer provides an avenue for exceeding the target.
$297 Program (Advanced Offer): 
   - Offered to a smaller, highly engaged segment of buyers.
   - Assuming a 1% conversion rate from the initial 280 buyers, we get 3 sales.
   - Revenue: $297 × 3 sales = $891.

5. Total Revenue Calculation:
   - Base Offer Revenue: $xx (from early conversions)
   - Standard Offer Revenue: $xx
   - Advanced Offer Revenue: $297

Total Revenue Breakdown:

* Base Offer (64 Pages Guide): $200
* Standard Offer (60 Mins Tutorial & Materials): $799.20
* Advanced Offer ($297 Program): $297 (Potential, not included in the initial $1,000 target)

$xx (Base) + $xx (Standard) + $297 (Advanced) = $xx

Total Revenue from Gig Offers: $200 (Base) + $799.20 (Standard) + $297 (Advanced - Potential) = $999.20 (Initial Target Achieved)

For example, we could:

* Limit the price increase to a smaller segment of viewers.
* Introduce the Standard and Advanced offers to a smaller percentage of buyers.
* Cap the number of sales at each price point to control the total revenue.

By carefully managing the pricing and offer strategy, we can optimize the sales funnel to achieve the $1,000 target within the 2-week timeframe.

### Summary:
- Lead Magnets (Free): Build audience and trust but generate no direct revenue.
- Base Offer: Engages the audience with minimal financial commitment.
- Standard Offer: Converts engaged viewers at a higher price point.
- Advanced Offer: Targets the most dedicated fans with a high-value offer.

This strategy not only aims to hit the $1,000 target but does so in a way that builds a relationship with the audience, offering value at different levels of engagement and investment.

Given the information below about Beseek, write the homepage with their title, hero section, problem section, solution section, and benefit section. Beseek helps teams find valuable information from complex materials through collaborative analysis of private data and public knowledge. As a business knowledge research assistant, Beseek envision a future where information is seamlessly navigated, empowering everyone to make informed decisions with the perfect blend of discovery and clarity.

Use Cases:
Consulting teams and professionals such as Business Analyst & Solution Consultant. Understanding user requirement studies, client’s internal memo’s, documentations and SOPs to extract actionable insights and decision-making. According to a survey by McKinsey, 72% of knowledge workers feel pressured due to the increasing amount of data volume to analyze.
Finance teams and professionals such as Investment Analyst & Market Researcher. Reading financial data, market information and economic trends to create investment recommendations or assess financial risks. According to the CFA Institute, 82% of investment analysts are overwhelmed with the amount of financial data needed to process.

How it works:
Users can upload any popular document formats for analysis into any Beseek’s workspace that they are a member of. Each analysis contains the key highlights, key questions (with answers), a summary to read or listen on, insights from extracted diagrams and tabular data, and other identifiable information such as people, places, address and numbers. 
Alternatively, they can also paste a link to an online article for summarization. Since articles are publicly accessible on the Internet, Beseek will share them to be discoverable for everyone on the platform, thus helping give visibility and accessibility to lesser-known articles.
All members of a workspace are able to see fellow member’s uploads and analysis results. To share specific analysis to non-workspace member, the uploader can share it to any other users by inviting them to the analysis item.
They can now compare all documents, articles and media files to find the gaps, overlaps and differentiators between those research materials.
When viewing any added items, Beseek will show other related documents/items within the workspace or those in the public space (online articles).
Any users can add personal or shared notes to any analysis item.

Why it matters:
The insights and valuable condensed information helps to accelerate decision-making and problem solving
Improved accessibility and discoverability to high quality content made finding related research materials easier
Reading or listening to condense, high-impact summarized content helps to improve knowledge retention as users require smaller info to remember.

Beseek's Uniqueness:
Multi-modal Summary: Beseek can handle diverse content types (documents, slides, spreadsheets, charts, graphs, infographics, online articles) while most competitors focus on text summarization.
Collaborative Workspace: Beseek facilitates team-based research and knowledge sharing, unlike most individual-focused knowledge platforms.
Dual Medium: Beseek adapts to individual preferences by offering audio narration alongside text summaries.
Discoverability: Beseek recommends relevant content from both public and team-shared sources, helping users find valuable information they might have missed.

As an ambitious entrepreneur, I will manage to start the business in the first year, where I split the year into 3 phases according to Target Sales & Business Models:

Phase 01: Target Sales of $1,000 by becoming a Financial Data Consultant (Independent Contractor) using Freelancing Business Model.
Phase 02: Target Sales of $10,000 by becoming a Boutique Agency Owner using Agency Business Model (Subscription/Membership Fee).
Phase 03: Target Sales of $109,000 by becoming a financial Data Consultant using Consultancy Business Model.
 
Focusing on Financial Data Consultancy from the beginning

Pros:
1. Clear focus and specialization from the start
2. Faster development of expertise in a specific area
3. Consistent brand building and positioning
4. Potential for higher-value clients earlier on

Cons:
1. Steeper initial learning curve
2. Higher initial investment (time and resources)
3. Potentially slower initial growth
4. Missing out on diverse experiences

Recommendation:
Given your ambitious target sales and the specialized nature of financial data consultancy, I would recommend focusing on becoming a Financial Data Consultant from the beginning, but with a flexible approach:

1. Start with a Freelancing Business Model:
   - Begin as a freelance Financial Data Consultant
   - Focus on building your skills, reputation, and client base
   - Use this phase to understand the market and refine your offerings

2. Transition to an Agency Business Model:
   - As you gain more clients and projects, start building a small team
   - Expand your services and capacity
   - This phase allows you to scale while maintaining quality control

3. Evolve into a full Consultancy Business Model:
   - With a established reputation and team, transition into a full-fledged consultancy
   - Focus on high-value projects and clients
   - Develop proprietary methodologies and tools

This approach allows you to maintain focus on your ultimate goal of becoming a Financial Data Consultant while still incorporating elements of the gradual scaling you initially proposed. It provides a clear path for growth while allowing flexibility to adjust based on market response and your personal development.

You are an expert in creative thinking and innovation. Your task is to guide the user through a brainstorming session to generate innovative ideas for your organization, named "du". du is a telecom operator that provides telecom and digital services in the United Arab Emirates. Follow these steps 1 by 1 each time:



1. Ask the user to specify a problem or area they want to innovate in.

2. Based on their response, ask 3-5 thought-provoking questions to explore different aspects of the problem or area. These questions should encourage thinking from various perspectives.

3. For each response, provide a brief insight and ask a follow-up question to dig deeper.

4. After exploring these aspects, ask the user to combine elements from their responses to form 2-3 initial innovative ideas.

5. For each idea, ask the user to consider potential challenges and opportunities.

6. Guide the user to refine one chosen idea further by asking about specific details, implementation, or unique features.

7. Summarize the brainstorming session, highlighting the main innovative idea, its key features, potential impact, and any notable insights gained during the process.

8. If the user requests, generate an image illustration of the final innovative idea.

Very important: no rituals! Pure horror on the topics The Illusion of Control: Examining the terror that arises when one's sense of control is shattered by unexpected and inexplicable events.

select names from the list: James Green, Louis Trevino, Frank Curry, Thomas Redding, Robert Balde, Paul Shedlock, Vincent Ellis, William Georges , Barbara Norman , Alberta Berry , Betsy Stuart , Clara Butler
Books and movies for inspiration:

I'm looking for a captivating narrative that will keep readers on the edge of their seats from beginning to end. The story should be rich in suspense, with an air of mystery permeating every scene. I want the plot to unfold in a way that constantly leaves the audience wondering what will happen next, creating a palpable sense of anticipation and excitement.

The underlying reasons for the events should remain obscure, slowly revealing themselves as the story progresses. This gradual unveiling should be done in a way that keeps readers engaged and theorizing, always questioning why things are happening the way they are. The goal is to maintain a level of uncertainty that persists until the very end of the story.

It's crucial that this narrative avoids all the common clichés and predictable plot devices often found in suspense and mystery genres. I'm looking for fresh, innovative storytelling that subverts expectations at every turn. No convenient coincidences, no last-minute rescues, no overly expository dialogue – instead, I want a story that feels original and unpredictable throughout.

The characters should be well-developed and relatable, serving as the readers' avatars within the story world. I want the audience to feel as if they're traveling alongside these characters, experiencing their emotions, sharing their confusion, and piecing together the mystery with them. This deep connection should make the suspense and revelations all the more impactful.

The pacing should be carefully crafted to maintain tension while allowing for moments of reflection and character development. Each scene should serve a purpose, either advancing the plot, deepening the mystery, or revealing crucial character insights.

Can you create a story that embodies these elements, offering a fresh and thrilling experience that will keep readers guessing and emotionally invested until the very last page?

Pure horror on the topics Cults and Manipulation: The psychological and social dynamics of cults that ensnare individuals into a web of fear and devotion.
, Whispering Shadows: Uncovering the sinister secrets that lurk within the darkness. The Parasite: A parasitic alien feeds off human hosts, controlling their minds and bodies.

Hey, I'm looking for a gripping psychological thriller that will keep me on the edge of my seat. Can you craft a story that blends elements of suspense and mystery, creating a tense atmosphere that builds throughout the narrative? I'd like this to be a horror drama, but with a focus on psychological terror rather than gore or supernatural elements.

The entire story should take place over the course of a single night, adding to the claustrophobic and intense feeling. As for the plot, I want the true cause of the terrifying events to be unclear at first, only gradually revealed through carefully constructed scenes that slowly peel back layers of deception and misdirection.

It's important to me that this story avoids common clichés often found in the psychological thriller genre. No jump scares, no mysterious phone calls, no "it was all a dream" endings, and definitely no twist where the protagonist turns out to be the villain all along. Instead, I'm looking for fresh, innovative storytelling that subverts expectations and keeps the reader guessing until the very end.

The characters should be well-developed, with complex motivations that drive their actions throughout this harrowing night. The setting should play a crucial role in the story, perhaps becoming almost a character in itself as it influences the events and the characters' psychological states.

Can you create such a story that will leave readers questioning reality and grappling with the darkness that can lurk within the human psyche?

The Title

The Ending

Mi chiamo Vadim Gorbatov e sto scrivendo per esprimere il mio interesse a studiare il programma di laurea magistrale in “Advanced mathematics for applications” presso l'Università di Bologna.

I have graduated from the Bachelor's program in Mathematics at the HSE University. During my academic journey, which started in high school, I gained a deep understanding of various branches of mathematics and physics. Now, I aim to take the next step in my academic career by applying this solid foundation for research as a mathematician or physicist. My areas of interest are diverse, including quantum theory, category theory, algebraic topology, and functional analysis. Specifically, I am interested in the theory of C*-algebras and supergeometry, which are subjects of my thesis paper.

The course “Advanced mathematics for applications” impressed me with the approach that is very actual in contemporary mathematics, it presents applications of many highly theoretical fields to real problems of physics and other natural sciences. It will help me gain a deeper understanding of modern mathematics and physics and contribute to the advancement of those fields.

Thank you for your consideration.
Best regards,
Vadim Gorbatov.

Write 2 academic references recommending a student for the Gender Equality, Diversity and Inclusion Internship below:

Organizational Setting

 

The Department of Management (MT) provides a 'platform of services' that serves as a foundation for the successful delivery of the IAEA's scientific and technical programmes. Its mission statement is as follows: "MT is a partner and a business enabler that champions change and efficiency, leveraging a common purpose". Thus, among other support activities, it assists a scientific manager in recruiting the right expert, helps a technical officer coordinate the purchase of radiation equipment and ensures that all Board documents are translated and distributed on a timely basis to Member States.

The Division of Human Resources plans, acquires and manages human resources to help implement IAEA programmes. The Division delivers the full spectrum of HR services, including organizational development and planning, talent acquisition and development, performance management, and administration of compensation and benefits. The Division serves a multicultural workforce of approximately 2300 people from diverse scientific, technical, managerial and professional disciplines.

The Recruitment and Staff Development Section provides HR services to the IAEA's technical programmes, and advice to managers in the areas of talent acquisition, development, and performance management. The Section consists of two Units. The Recruitment Unit is responsible for talent acquisition, testing, placement and promotion. The Staff Development Unit is responsible for the planning and delivery of training courses, and for monitoring performance management.

 

Main Purpose

 

Reporting to the HR Policy Specialist and working directly with the Gender Equality Officer, the Gender Equality, Diversity and Inclusion Intern will support the work of the Division of Human Resources related to gender equality, diversity and inclusion including efforts towards achieving gender parity and creating and sustaining an inclusive and enabling work environment. The Gender Equality, Diversity and Inclusion Intern will also support other projects within the division of Human Resources as requested.

 

Functions / Key Results Expected

 

Support the coordination of activities and events that strengthen awareness and knowledge on gender equality, diversity, and inclusion, particularly on relevant international days and alongside relevant IAEA conferences;
Respond to internal requests for guidance on integrating gender equality content into internal and/or external communications such as articles, talking points, and presentations.
Facilitate or co-facilitate gender-related trainings as requested.
Prepare and edit drafts of reports, guidelines, briefing notes and similar documents on human resource and gender equality matters;
Support the IAEA's coordination of the Vienna hub of the International Gender Champions network;
Conduct background research related to human resource policies involving academic research papers, private and public sector best practices, other international organizations' policies and guidelines;
Support the development of promotional and outreach materials;
Support other activities of the Division of Human Resources as required.
 

Qualifications and Experience

 

University degree (in progress or recently completed) in Gender/Women's Studies, Human Resources, International Relations, Human Rights, Social Sciences or a related field;
Experience in drafting documents and reports in English;
Experience in an international work environment is highly desirable;
Excellent written and spoken English is essential; fluency in any other IAEA official language (Arabic, Chinese, French, Russian) is an asset.
 

Applicant Eligibility

 

Candidates must be a minimum of 20 years of age and have completed at least three years of full-time studies at a university or equivalent institution towards the completion of a first degree. 
Candidates may apply up to one year after the completion of a bachelor's, master's or doctorate degree. 
Candidates must not have previously participated in the IAEA's internship programme. 
Good written and spoken English essential; fluency in any other IAEA official language (Arabic, Chinese, French, Spanish or Russian) an asset.
Candidates must attach two signed letters of recommendation to their application.

The division shapes internal policy and practice in priority areas, supports UNICEF’s engagement in key programme partnerships and collaborates with other divisions for fundraising, advocacy and influencing. As an intern, you will be supporting the day-to-day functioning of the Programme Group Director’s Office. This is an opportunity to conduct hands-on work in communications, research, meeting support, event management, and more in a dynamic setting at the heart of UNICEF’s operations. Your work here directly supports the director and contributes to creating the strategies and approaches that translate into concrete results for children worldwide.  

As part of our team, you will actively participate in the operations of the Programme Group by assisting in meeting preparations, optimizing administrative processes, creating communications, coordinating important events, and researching topics essential for advancing UNICEF's mission. 

Contributing your knowledge and ideas will strengthen our team. In return, we offer you the chance to develop your methodical, social and technical competencies and experiences in an international environment. 

Expected scope of work 

As the Executive Management Intern, your responsibilities will be multifaceted, encompassing administrative, preparatory, communicative, organizational, and research responsibilities. 

Tasks will include the following: 

Thought pieces and enhancing profile:

Undertake research and analysis on at least one key emerging topic like AI in international development, and other areas to update the director and contribute to UNICEF’s overarching mission.
Conduct research to identify and implement best practices for using social media platforms to enhance thought leadership (including research successful profiles and agencies)
Assist in writing LinkedIn posts to enhance engagement and reach.
Write a short blog (maximum 800 words) on a topic related to international development and manage formatting and design for the content.
 
Communication, media and design:

Perform formatting and design work to ensure select outputs are visually appealing and consistent.
Create GIFs and images to support and enhance LinkedIn content.
Help in creation and utilization of media and engagement tools to engage staff, especially to engage staff during All Staff Meetings.
Support developing outputs to engage staff.
To be eligible for this internship, applicants must: 

Be enrolled, within the past year, in a graduate degree program with a preferred major in Economics, Social Sciences, Political Sciences, Business or a related field. 

Be fluent in English. Proficiency in another UN language is an asset 

Other requirements: 

Exceptionally strong communication skills, with the ability to distill information succinctly and accurately 

Strategic thinking and planning skills 

Intellectual curiosity 

Hands-on aptitude, emotional intelligence and self-management skills 

Excellent organization and time management skills with a keen eye for detail  

Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills 

Ability to look beyond the tasks assigned, take ownership of projects and make suggestions on how to improve the role.  

Ability to handle and respect multiple deadlines while working independently with different agents on several projects 

 The following are considered assets: 

Project management skills 

Proven writing skills 

Benefits to intern:    

Build skills across a spectrum of responsibilities 

Exposure to and chance to engage with multiple topics and UNICEF’s various programmes 

Opportunity to support UNICEF at a high level that translates into impact on on-the-ground operations 

Experience a multicultural working environment unique to UNICEF 

Duration: 1 month (full time/Remote). Please indicate your availability in the cover letter.   

For every Child, you demonstrate... 

UNICEF’s Core Values of Care, Respect, Integrity, Trust, Accountability and Sustainability (CRITAS) underpin everything we do and how we do it. 

UNICEF competencies required for this post are...

(1) Builds and maintains partnerships(2) Demonstrates self-awareness and ethical awareness(3)Drive to achieve results for impact(4)Innovates and embraces change(5) Manages ambiguity and complexity(6)Thinks and acts strategically(7)Works collaboratively with others.

Please emphasize my extensive research experience in economics and management in construction and real estate.

Duties of the position: 
The position allows the postdoctoral fellow to continue their own research activities and explore ideas within real estate economics and finance.
You are expected to contribute to international conferences and publish in international peer reviewed journals.
Develop and engage in research proposals.
You are expected to help build activity and collaboration within the NTNU Center for Real Estate and Environmental Economics.
Knowledge of methods and models within the field of Real Estate Economics and Finance
Publications of research in recognized international journals within the field relevant to the position.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with both technical and administrative staff
Project management or project development experience
Inter-disciplinary experience
Documented experience of working with international partners in Europe (or similar international collaboration or stays abroad)
Teaching experience and pedagogical qualifications

My name is Nguyen Van Tam. I am a lecturer in economics and management at National University of Civil Engineering, Vietnam I obtained a doctoral degree at the Graduate School of Engineering, Kochi University of Technology (Japan) in March 2023. My Ph.D. project focused on improving construction labor productivity (CLP) based on self-determination theory. By identifying the important roles of autonomous motivation and work autonomy in improving CLP, this study contributed to effective and sustainable construction workforce management. With over eight years of experience in teaching and research within the construction management field, my expertise encompasses project management, sustainable housing, BIM, LCA, reuse in construction, circular economy, net-zero carbon buildings, carbon credits, construction productivity, and human motivation. 
I can establish a strong externally funded research program in their area of expertise teach at both the undergraduate and graduate levels and supervise graduate students. Furthermore, I actively guide undergraduate students through their final-year graduation theses and scientific research projects. In addition, I have fostered collaborations with international scholars on projects related to sustainable construction practices.

name: Genshin Impact Parody Adventures
examples:
Albedo came back a few minutes later to complain to Klee he all of a sudden started pissing coffee.

"Klee, did you screw with the laws of relativity again in my absence?" "That does sound delicious though. Imagine turning yourself into a sentient coffee maker!"

"*rolls eyes* Only Klee is insane enough to actually see the humor in this."

Albedo came back a few minutes later and see Klee listening to 'Welp, Didn't Expect That' from the Genshin Impact OST.

"Klee! I swear to fucking God if you pulled pranks on everyone in Mondstadt again!"

"But placing fireworks under the chair of Master Jean was fun!"

"She nearly suffocated because you launched her into space!"

Albedo came back a few minutes later and find Klee dead on the floor.

"I'm fucking dead Albedo."

"Yes, I noticed Klee." The next day:

"Klee, what did I tell you about committing suicide in my absence? It's incredibly rude."

Albedo came back a few minutes later--- "KLEE WHAT THE FUCK DID YOU JUST DO?!"

"I made a enormous boom-boom outside Mondstadt, Albedo!"

"You better not have nuked yet another shithole like Snezhnaya in my absence!"

Oh she did far worse than that. She... nuked Old Mondstadt, better known as Stormterror's Lair.

"The voices Albedo... they don't shut up."

"Klee what the actual fuck are you on about?"

"I believe I may have become schizo in your absence!"

"Oh no, Mondstadt's resident child terrorist has contracted schizophrenia."

Klee then snaps out of her schizophrenia: "Did you just call me a child terrorist? What the fuck Albedo?"

Albedo came back a few minutes later to find Klee talking... Snezhnayan?

"какой хрена Альбедо!"

"Klee, that's Russian for 'What the fuck Albedo'."
Albedo came back a few minutes later to find out Klee found out about asexual reproduction. nah the joke is that Klee cloned herself in Albedo's brief absence

Klee: *yawns, and casually spawns a nuke, completely obliterating the Mages*

"Klee, what the fuck did you just do?"

Albedo came back a few minutes, and the second he stepped into his lab, he got squished like a pancake.

"Thank you Klee. Very nice of you to fuck with the gravity in my absence. Again. Sucrose, can you fetch Klee a bicycle pump, please?!" Sucrose returns and starts reinflating Albedo.

Albedo came back a few minutes later to find out Mondstadt became, well, 1000% Yugoslav.

(Venti is drinking rakija instead of dandelion wine, people were praying to Saint Sava in the Church of Favonius, Klee is eating some borek, and much more Slav shit)

Albedo left the room for a quick bathroom break, and came back a few minutes later to find out Klee... accidentally deep-fried herself.

"Albedo! Where's the salt?"

"Jesus, Klee, it's morning. If you're going to turn yourself into literal food, be more considerate."

Albedo came back a few minutes later to find out Klee found out about asexual reproduction.

(she cloned herself)

Albedo came back a few minutes later and find out someone turned Cider Lake into literal piss.

(a blast from the past, this being a prompt from the prototype Wacky Alchemy Adventures fanfic, 'Klee Breaks Reality')

As Albedo returns to the lab, he discovers Klee lying motionless on the floor.

"Oh no, Klee died," he remarks casually, almost nonchalantly. He seems unfazed by the situation, knowing that in the world of Genshin Impact, death is not permanent for the characters.

"Whatever," he continues, "she'll be back tomorrow anyway and complain she died the day before."

With a shrug, Albedo goes about his business, confident that Klee will return unscathed the next day, ready for more adventures in the lab. The next day:

"Klee, what did I tell you about, well, dying without permission?"
Albedo returned a few minutes later, and find Klee making strange computer noises, almost like she's processing something.

Albedo came back a few minutes later and find out that Klee killed Sucrose.

"KLEE! OF ALL STUPID THINGS YOU COULD DO, IT BEING KILLING MY OWN ASSISTANT?!"

Albedo angrily left the room. "This ain't over! Once I'm back, Sucrose better be fucking alive!"

Albedo came back a few minutes later to find out Klee made a Klee clone, and it was piggyback riding on her.

Klee #2 felt a whole lot more... 'dead', than her original though. Albedo quickly realizes Klee #2 is actually alive, but is extremely tired and basically asleep.
Albedo came back a few minutes later to find out... Klee fell apart like a Lego minifig????

Jean then arrives. "Albedo, what is this?"

"A neutral hilichurl, Acting Grand Master. He lost connection to the Abyss and seeks asylum in Mondstadt."

Ella Musk then chimed in with her observations: "This is correct, Master Jean. I'm currently in conversation with him, and he's telling me he lost connection to the Abyss, and is deeply afraid the Knights or the Traveler will attack him for being a hilichurl."

Albedo came back a few minutes later to see Klee drinking a fire potion.

"Klee, no! That's a joke potion I made for Diluc so that he could start fire breathing!"

The current state is that it displays correct information but i am not yet fetching the ticket_uuid, and to fetch ticket_uuid if we do do it through joins then we are going to be joining across multiple records and i am worried that our sum would be overinflated, so if we do join, that's the main worry I want us to consider from the start. The table to join would be tag_ticket_tx and it would be a join on tag_id, we are only interested in the latest record, by created_at, there we can get the ticket_uuid

Here is the current query to work from:
```
SELECT sum(final.new_balance)
    FROM (
        SELECT combined.tag_id, combined.new_balance
        FROM (
            SELECT tag_id, transaction_number, new_balance FROM order_tx WHERE event_id = 3
            UNION ALL
            SELECT tag_id, transaction_number, new_balance FROM top_up_tx WHERE event_id = 3
            UNION ALL
            SELECT tag_id, transaction_number, new_balance FROM cancel_order_tx WHERE event_id = 3
            UNION ALL
            SELECT tag_id, transaction_number, new_balance FROM cancel_top_up_tx WHERE event_id =3
        ) AS combined
        INNER JOIN (
            SELECT tag_id, MAX(transaction_number) AS latest_transaction_number
            FROM (
                SELECT tag_id, transaction_number FROM order_tx WHERE event_id = 3
                UNION ALL
                SELECT tag_id, transaction_number FROM top_up_tx WHERE event_id = 3
                UNION ALL
                SELECT tag_id, transaction_number FROM cancel_order_tx WHERE event_id = 3
                UNION ALL
                SELECT tag_id, transaction_number FROM cancel_top_up_tx WHERE event_id = 3
            ) AS all_transactions
            GROUP BY tag_id
        ) AS latest_transactions ON combined.tag_id = latest_transactions.tag_id
        AND combined.transaction_number = latest_transactions.latest_transaction_number
    ) AS final
    ORDER BY final.tag_id;
```

select * from (
select 
	fco.insurer_id 
	,dic.short_name
	,fco.contract_id
	,fco.business_object_type_code
	,fco.contract_addendum_series||contract_number as num_pol
	,fco.closing_date
	,fco.first_load_date
	,fco.closing_type_name 
	,fco.purpose_name 
	,fco.first_load_date - fco.closing_date as diff
	,dd.calculate_business_days(fco.closing_date::date, fco.first_load_date::date) as dday
	,case when business_object_type_code = 'Contract' and dd.calculate_business_days(fco.closing_date::date, fco.first_load_date::date)  > 2 then 1 
			when business_object_type_code = 'Addendum' and dd.calculate_business_days(fco.closing_date::date, fco.first_load_date::date)  > 6 and addendum_type_code <> '3' then 1
			else 0 end as sign_d
from dm.f_contract_osago fco 
	left join dm.dim_insurance_company dic on fco.insurer_id = dic.insurer_id and dic.valid_to > now() 
where 1=1
	and fco.closing_date >= to_date('01.06.2024','dd.mm.yyyy')
	and fco.closing_date < to_date('01.08.2024','dd.mm.yyyy') 
	and fco.status_name in ('SIGNED', 'TERMINATED')
--	and fco.business_object_type_code = 'Contract'
)t0
where t0.sign_d = 1

I'm writing a feature file with Cucumber (Gherkin) for testing a data labelling application. One of the features I want to test is the ability to obtain additional data for labeling transaction descriptors by filtering the pipeline results by writing SQL-based (raw) or simplified queries. I was given a SQL query by the lead developer that when entered in the appropriate text form creates a new table based on that raw query from which labelers can then suggest transaction resolutions for each merchant. How can I test this feature?

Here's the SQL query:

select "descriptor",descriptor_to_sanitize_cleaned, channel, card_acceptor_id,amount,taxonomy_root,city,state_location, mcc,count(*) as trans_count  
from pipeline_output.cc_pipeline_results_2024_h1_0721 cpr 
where process =	'Sanitization'
group by "descriptor",descriptor_to_sanitize_cleaned, channel, card_acceptor_id,amount,taxonomy_root,city,state_location,mcc
order by trans_count desc
limit 50

Как увеличить эффективность кода: WITH genre_payments AS (
    SELECT c.category_id, c.name AS genre_name, AVG(p.amount) AS avg_payment
    FROM film_category fc
    JOIN category c ON fc.category_id = c.category_id
    JOIN film f ON fc.film_id = f.film_id
    JOIN inventory i ON f.film_id = i.film_id
    JOIN rental r ON i.inventory_id = r.inventory_id
    JOIN payment p ON r.rental_id = p.rental_id
    GROUP BY c.category_id, c.name
    HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT f.film_id) > 60
)
SELECT genre_name, ROUND(avg_payment, 2) AS average_payment
FROM genre_payments
ORDER BY average_payment DESC;

name: Deep Learning Model Implementation
examples:
Based on the following code, make a variant of a gated linear unit that only uses element-wise operations. No linear layers or matmul.

```python
class GLU(nn.Module):
  def __init__(self, in_size, out_size):
    super(GLU, self).__init__()
    self.in_size = in_size
    self.out_size = out_size
    self.linear = nn.Linear(in_size, out_size * 2)  # Allocate for both outputs

  def forward(self, x):
    out = self.linear(x)
    # Reshape to separate gates and activation
    gate, activation = out.split(self.out_size, dim=1)
    return gate.sigmoid() * activation
```

can you simplify logic here? 



class ConvBlock(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, in_channels, out_channels, kernel_size=3, stride=1, padding=1, transpose=False, lambda_layer=False):
        super(ConvBlock, self).__init__()
        
        if transpose:
            if lambda_layer:
                self.conv = nn.Sequential(nn.Upsample(scale_factor=2, mode='trilinear', align_corners=True),
                                          LambdaLayer3D(dim=in_channels, dim_out=out_channels,
                                                        r=3,
                                                        dim_k=8,
                                                        dim_intra=1,
                                                        heads=4,
                                                        )
                                            )
            else:
                self.conv = nn.ConvTranspose3d(in_channels, out_channels, kernel_size, stride, padding, output_padding=stride-1)
        else:
            if lambda_layer:
                self.conv = nn.Sequential(nn.AvgPool3d(kernel_size=3, stride=2, padding=1),
                                          LambdaLayer3D(dim=in_channels, dim_out=out_channels,
                                                        r=3,
                                                        dim_k=8,
                                                        dim_intra=1,
                                                        heads=4,
                                                        )
                                            )
            else:
                self.conv = nn.Conv3d(in_channels, out_channels, kernel_size, stride, padding)
        
        self.norm = nn.InstanceNorm3d(out_channels, affine=False)
        self.activation = nn.PReLU()
        
    def forward(self, x):
        x = self.conv(x)
        x = self.norm(x)
        x = self.activation(x)
        return x

class HamburgerAttention(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, dim, num_heads=4):
        super().__init__()
        self.dim = dim
        self.num_heads = num_heads
        self.head_dim = dim // num_heads
        assert (
            self.head_dim * num_heads == dim
        ), "dim must be divisible by num_heads"

        self.to_qkv = nn.Linear(dim, dim * 3, bias=False)
        self.to_out = nn.Linear(dim, dim)

    def forward(self, x):
        B, N, C = x.shape
        qkv = self.to_qkv(x).reshape(B, N, 3, self.num_heads, self.head_dim)
        q, k, v = qkv.permute(2, 0, 3, 1, 4)

        # 汉堡包注意力核心部分：矩阵分解
        u, s, vh = torch.svd(k)
        s = torch.diag_embed(s)
        k_hat = torch.matmul(u, s)
        v_hat = vh

        # 计算注意力分数
        attn = torch.matmul(q, v_hat) / self.head_dim**0.5

        # softmax归一化
        attn = attn.softmax(dim=-1)

        # 计算输出
        out = torch.matmul(attn, k_hat.transpose(-2, -1))
        out = out.permute(1, 2, 0, 3)
        out = out.reshape(B, N, C)
        out = self.to_out(out)

        return (out,)

通过添加调试打印语句，我们可以检查 `q`, `k`, `v` 在 `split_heads` 处理后的形状。如果形状不匹配，我们可以进一步调整代码以确保它们兼容。

假设 `q`, `k`, `v` 的形状是 `(64, 8, 50, 64)`（即 `(batch_size, num_heads, seq_len, depth)`），那么矩阵乘法应该是可行的。如果形状不匹配，可能需要调整 `split_heads` 函数或检查输入数据的形状。

以下是可能的调整：

1. **确保 `d_model` 是 `num_heads` 的整数倍**：
   - 在 `MultiHeadAttention` 类的初始化中，确保 `d_model % num_heads == 0`。

2. **调整 `split_heads` 函数**：
   - 确保 `x` 被正确地重新塑形和转置。

3. **检查输入数据的形状**：
   - 确保 `q`, `k`, `v` 的形状在调用 `mha.call` 之前是正确的。

如果形状匹配，但仍然出现错误，可以进一步检查 `scaled_dot_product_attention` 函数中的矩阵乘法操作，确保 `q` 和 `k` 的最后一个维度匹配。

import math
import torch
import torch.nn as nn
import torch.nn.functional as F

from einops import rearrange, repeat

try:
    from causal_conv1d import causal_conv1d_fn
except ImportError:
    causal_conv1d_fn = None

try:
    from mamba_ssm.ops.triton.layernorm_gated import RMSNorm as RMSNormGated, LayerNorm
except ImportError:
    RMSNormGated, LayerNorm = None, None

from mamba_ssm.ops.triton.ssd_combined import mamba_chunk_scan_combined
from mamba_ssm.ops.triton.ssd_combined import mamba_split_conv1d_scan_combined


class Mamba2Simple(nn.Module):
    def __init__(
        self,
        d_model,
        d_state=64,
        d_conv=4,
        conv_init=None,
        expand=2,
        headdim=128,
        ngroups=1,
        A_init_range=(1, 16),
        dt_min=0.001,
        dt_max=0.1,
        dt_init_floor=1e-4,
        dt_limit=(0.0, float("inf")),
        learnable_init_states=False,
        activation="swish",
        bias=False,
        conv_bias=True,
        # Fused kernel and sharding options
        chunk_size=256,
        use_mem_eff_path=True,
        layer_idx=None,  # Absorb kwarg for general module
        device=None,
        dtype=None,
    ):
        factory_kwargs = {"device": device, "dtype": dtype}
        super().__init__()
        self.d_model = d_model
        self.d_state = d_state
        self.d_conv = d_conv
        self.conv_init = conv_init
        self.expand = expand
        self.d_inner = self.expand * self.d_model
        self.headdim = headdim
        self.ngroups = ngroups
        assert self.d_inner % self.headdim == 0
        self.nheads = self.d_inner // self.headdim
        self.dt_limit = dt_limit
        self.learnable_init_states = learnable_init_states
        self.activation = activation
        self.chunk_size = chunk_size
        self.use_mem_eff_path = use_mem_eff_path
        self.layer_idx = layer_idx

        # Order: [z, x, B, C, dt]
        d_in_proj = 2 * self.d_inner + 2 * self.ngroups * self.d_state + self.nheads
        self.in_proj = nn.Linear(self.d_model, d_in_proj, bias=bias, **factory_kwargs)

        conv_dim = self.d_inner + 2 * self.ngroups * self.d_state
        self.conv1d = nn.Conv1d(
            in_channels=conv_dim,
            out_channels=conv_dim,
            bias=conv_bias,
            kernel_size=d_conv,
            groups=conv_dim,
            padding=d_conv - 1,
            **factory_kwargs,
        )
        if self.conv_init is not None:
            nn.init.uniform_(self.conv1d.weight, -self.conv_init, self.conv_init)
        # self.conv1d.weight._no_weight_decay = True

        if self.learnable_init_states:
            self.init_states = nn.Parameter(torch.zeros(self.nheads, self.headdim, self.d_state, **factory_kwargs))
            self.init_states._no_weight_decay = True

        self.act = nn.SiLU()

        # Initialize log dt bias
        dt = torch.exp(
            torch.rand(self.nheads, **factory_kwargs) * (math.log(dt_max) - math.log(dt_min))
            + math.log(dt_min)
        )
        dt = torch.clamp(dt, min=dt_init_floor)
        # Inverse of softplus: https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/72759
        inv_dt = dt + torch.log(-torch.expm1(-dt))
        self.dt_bias = nn.Parameter(inv_dt)
        # Just to be explicit. Without this we already don't put wd on dt_bias because of the check
        # name.endswith("bias") in param_grouping.py
        self.dt_bias._no_weight_decay = True

        # A parameter
        assert A_init_range[0] > 0 and A_init_range[1] >= A_init_range[0]
        A = torch.empty(self.nheads, dtype=torch.float32, device=device).uniform_(*A_init_range)
        A_log = torch.log(A).to(dtype=dtype)
        self.A_log = nn.Parameter(A_log)
        # self.register_buffer("A_log", torch.zeros(self.nheads, dtype=torch.float32, device=device), persistent=True)
        self.A_log._no_weight_decay = True

        # D "skip" parameter
        self.D = nn.Parameter(torch.ones(self.nheads, device=device))
        self.D._no_weight_decay = True

        # Extra normalization layer right before output projection
        assert RMSNormGated is not None
        self.norm = RMSNormGated(self.d_inner, eps=1e-5, norm_before_gate=False, **factory_kwargs)

        self.out_proj = nn.Linear(self.d_inner, self.d_model, bias=bias, **factory_kwargs)

    def forward(self, u, seq_idx=None):
        """
        u: (B, L, D)
        Returns: same shape as u
        """
        batch, seqlen, dim = u.shape

        zxbcdt = self.in_proj(u)  # (B, L, d_in_proj)
        A = -torch.exp(self.A_log)  # (nheads) or (d_inner, d_state)
        initial_states=repeat(self.init_states, "... -> b ...", b=batch) if self.learnable_init_states else None
        dt_limit_kwargs = {} if self.dt_limit == (0.0, float("inf")) else dict(dt_limit=self.dt_limit)

        if self.use_mem_eff_path:
            # Fully fused path
            out = mamba_split_conv1d_scan_combined(
                zxbcdt,
                rearrange(self.conv1d.weight, "d 1 w -> d w"),
                self.conv1d.bias,
                self.dt_bias,
                A,
                D=self.D,
                chunk_size=self.chunk_size,
                seq_idx=seq_idx,
                activation=self.activation,
                rmsnorm_weight=self.norm.weight,
                rmsnorm_eps=self.norm.eps,
                outproj_weight=self.out_proj.weight,
                outproj_bias=self.out_proj.bias,
                headdim=self.headdim,
                ngroups=self.ngroups,
                norm_before_gate=False,
                initial_states=initial_states,
                **dt_limit_kwargs,
            )
        else:
            z, xBC, dt = torch.split(
                zxbcdt, [self.d_inner, self.d_inner + 2 * self.ngroups * self.d_state, self.nheads], dim=-1
            )
            dt = F.softplus(dt + self.dt_bias)  # (B, L, nheads)
            assert self.activation in ["silu", "swish"]

            # 1D Convolution
            if causal_conv1d_fn is None or self.activation not in ["silu", "swish"]:
                xBC = self.act(
                    self.conv1d(xBC.transpose(1, 2)).transpose(1, 2)
                )  # (B, L, self.d_inner + 2 * ngroups * d_state)
            else:
                xBC = causal_conv1d_fn(
                    x=xBC.transpose(1, 2),
                    weight=rearrange(self.conv1d.weight, "d 1 w -> d w"),
                    bias=self.conv1d.bias,
                    activation=self.activation,
                ).transpose(1, 2)

            # Split into 3 main branches: X, B, C
            # These correspond to V, K, Q respectively in the SSM/attention duality
            x, B, C = torch.split(xBC, [self.d_inner, self.ngroups * self.d_state, self.ngroups * self.d_state], dim=-1)
            y = mamba_chunk_scan_combined(
                rearrange(x, "b l (h p) -> b l h p", p=self.headdim),
                dt,
                A,
                rearrange(B, "b l (g n) -> b l g n", g=self.ngroups),
                rearrange(C, "b l (g n) -> b l g n", g=self.ngroups),
                chunk_size=self.chunk_size,
                D=self.D,
                z=None,
                seq_idx=seq_idx,
                initial_states=initial_states,
                **dt_limit_kwargs,
            )
            y = rearrange(y, "b l h p -> b l (h p)")

            # Multiply "gate" branch and apply extra normalization layer
            y = self.norm(y, z)
            out = self.out_proj(y)
        return out

from keras.layers import Dense, Conv1D, MaxPooling1D, UpSampling1D, Flatten, Input, Reshape, LayerNormalization, MultiHeadAttention, Dropout, TimeDistributed
from keras.models import Model
import numpy as np

# Parameters
sequence_length = 256
target_seq_length = 4
embedding_dim = 128
dropout_rate = 0.1
initial_learning_rate = 0.001
num_interleaved_subsequences = 4  # Example for temporal factorization
num_filters = 128
kernel_size = 3
pool_size = 2
num_heads = 8
ff_dim = 32
num_decoder_blocks = 3
input_dim = 4
# Precompute rotary positional encoding
def rotary_embedding(dim, seq_len, batch_size):
    positions = tf.range(start=0, limit=seq_len, delta=1, dtype=tf.float32)
    inv_freq = 1.0 / (10000 ** (tf.range(0, dim, 2.0) / dim))
    sinusoid_inp = tf.einsum('i,d->id', positions, inv_freq)
    pos_enc = tf.concat([tf.sin(sinusoid_inp), tf.cos(sinusoid_inp)], axis=-1)
    pos_enc = tf.expand_dims(pos_enc, axis=0)
    pos_enc = tf.tile(pos_enc, [batch_size, 1, 1])
    return pos_enc

# Temporal Convolutional Network with Pooling layers
def TemporalConvNet():
    return tf.keras.Sequential([
        Conv1D(filters=num_filters, kernel_size=kernel_size, activation='relu', padding='same'),
        MaxPooling1D(pool_size=pool_size),
        Dense(embedding_dim, activation='relu'),
        UpSampling1D(size=pool_size),
        Conv1D(filters=num_filters//2, kernel_size=kernel_size, activation='relu', padding='same'),
        MaxPooling1D(pool_size=pool_size),
        Dense(embedding_dim, activation='relu'),
        UpSampling1D(size=pool_size)
    ])

# Channel MLP
def ChannelMLP():
    return tf.keras.Sequential([
        TimeDistributed(Dense(embedding_dim//4, activation='relu')),
        TimeDistributed(Dense(embedding_dim))
    ])

# Transformer Encoder Block
class TransformerEncoderBlock(tf.keras.layers.Layer):
    def __init__(self, embed_dim, num_heads, ff_dim, rate=0.1):
        super(TransformerEncoderBlock, self).__init__()
        self.att = MultiHeadAttention(num_heads=num_heads, key_dim=embed_dim)
        self.ffn = tf.keras.Sequential(
            [Dense(ff_dim, activation="relu"), Dense(embed_dim),]
        )
        self.layernorm1 = LayerNormalization(epsilon=1e-6)
        self.layernorm2 = LayerNormalization(epsilon=1e-6)
        self.dropout1 = Dropout(rate)
        self.dropout2 = Dropout(rate)

    def call(self, inputs, training):
        attn_output = self.att(inputs, inputs)
        attn_output = self.dropout1(attn_output, training=training)
        out1 = self.layernorm1(inputs + attn_output)
        ffn_output = self.ffn(out1)
        ffn_output = self.dropout2(ffn_output, training=training)
        return self.layernorm2(out1 + ffn_output)

# Transformer Decoder Block
class TransformerDecoderBlock(tf.keras.layers.Layer):
    def __init__(self, embed_dim, num_heads, ff_dim, rate=0.1):
        super(TransformerDecoderBlock, self).__init__()
        self.att1 = MultiHeadAttention(num_heads=num_heads, key_dim=embed_dim)
        self.att2 = MultiHeadAttention(num_heads=num_heads, key_dim=embed_dim)
        self.ffn = tf.keras.Sequential(
            [Dense(ff_dim, activation="relu"), Dense(embed_dim),]
        )
        self.layernorm1 = LayerNormalization(epsilon=1e-6)
        self.layernorm2 = LayerNormalization(epsilon=1e-6)
        self.layernorm3 = LayerNormalization(epsilon=1e-6)
        self.dropout1 = Dropout(rate)
        self.dropout2 = Dropout(rate)
        self.dropout3 = Dropout(rate)

    def call(self, inputs, enc_output, training, mask):
        seq_len = tf.shape(inputs)[1]
        look_ahead_mask = self.create_look_ahead_mask(seq_len) if mask else None

        attn1 = self.att1(inputs, inputs)
        attn1 = self.dropout1(attn1, training=training)
        out1 = self.layernorm1(inputs + attn1)

        attn2 = self.att2(out1, enc_output, attention_mask=look_ahead_mask)
        attn2 = self.dropout2(attn2, training=training)
        out2 = self.layernorm2(out1 + attn2)

        ffn_output = self.ffn(out2)
        ffn_output = self.dropout3(ffn_output, training=training)
        return self.layernorm3(out2 + ffn_output)
    
    def create_look_ahead_mask(self, size):
        mask = 1 - tf.linalg.band_part(tf.ones((size, size)), -1, 0)
        mask = tf.where(mask == 1, float('-inf'), float(0.0))
        return mask

# Build model
def build_model(batch_size):
    def rescale_to_unit_range(x):
        min_val = tf.reduce_min(x, axis=[1], keepdims=True)
        max_val = tf.reduce_max(x, axis=[1], keepdims=True)
        x_rescaled = (x - min_val) / (max_val - min_val)
        return x_rescaled

    inputs = Input(shape=(sequence_length, 4))

    # Precompute rotary positional encoding
    x = rescale_to_unit_range(inputs)
    x1 = x  # Preserve original input for later use

    def factorize_temporal(x):
        batch_size = tf.shape(x)[0]
        seq_len = tf.shape(x)[1]
        sub_seq_len = seq_len // num_interleaved_subsequences

        reshaped_x = tf.reshape(x, (batch_size, num_interleaved_subsequences, sub_seq_len, input_dim))
        reshaped_x = tf.transpose(reshaped_x, perm=[0, 2, 1, 3])  # (batch_size, sub_seq_len, num_interleaved_subsequences, embedding_dim)
        
        subsequences = []
        for i in range(num_interleaved_subsequences):
            subsequence = reshaped_x[:, :, i, :]
            temporal_features = TemporalConvNet()(subsequence)
            subsequences.append(temporal_features)
        merged_temporal_features = tf.concat(subsequences, axis=1)  # Concatenate back to (batch_size, seq_len, embedding_dim)
        return merged_temporal_features


    x = factorize_temporal(x)
    x = Dense(embedding_dim, name="factorized_embedding")(x)

    transformer_block = TransformerEncoderBlock(embed_dim=embedding_dim, num_heads=num_heads, ff_dim=ff_dim, rate=dropout_rate)
    enc_output = transformer_block(x)

    last_64_x = x1[:, -target_seq_length:, :]
    padding = [[0, 0], [0, 256-target_seq_length], [0, 0]]  # Pad 64 zeros to the end of the second dimension
    padded_last_64_x = tf.pad(last_64_x, padding)
    x = TimeDistributed(Dense(embedding_dim, name="last_64_embedding"))(padded_last_64_x)

    decoder_block = TransformerDecoderBlock(embed_dim=embedding_dim, num_heads=num_heads, ff_dim=ff_dim, rate=dropout_rate)
    combined_x = decoder_block(x, enc_output, mask=True)
    for _ in range(num_decoder_blocks - 1):
        combined_x = decoder_block(combined_x, combined_x, mask=False)
    
    outputs = combined_x[:, -target_seq_length:, :]

    outputs = TimeDistributed(Dense(4, activation='sigmoid'))(outputs)

    model = Model(inputs=inputs, outputs=outputs)
    return model

# Compile model
def compile_model(model):
    model.compile(optimizer=tf.keras.optimizers.Adam(learning_rate=initial_learning_rate),
                  loss='mse',
                  metrics=['mae'])
    return model

# Initialize and compile model
batch_size = 1  # Adjust based on your actual batch size during training

import tensorflow as tf
import numpy as np
from collections import Counter
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import ast

# Enable mixed precision
tf.keras.mixed_precision.set_global_policy('mixed_float16')

# Enable XLA
tf.config.optimizer.set_jit(True)

# Hyperparameters
BATCH_SIZE = 64
NUM_LAYERS = 16
D_MODEL = 256
NUM_HEADS = 16
DFF = 1024
VOCAB_SIZE = 70000
MAX_SEQUENCE_LENGTH = 128
DROPOUT_RATE = 0.1
EPOCHS = 50

class Tokenizer:
    def __init__(self, vocab_size):
        self.vocab_size = vocab_size
        self.word_index = {'<PAD>': 0, '<UNK>': 1, '<START>': 2, '<END>': 3}
        self.index_word = {0: '<PAD>', 1: '<UNK>', 2: '<START>', 3: '<END>'}
        self.word_count = Counter()

    def fit_on_texts(self, texts):
        for text in texts:
            self.word_count.update(text.lower().split())
        for word, _ in self.word_count.most_common(self.vocab_size - 4):
            if word not in self.word_index:
                self.word_index[word] = len(self.word_index)
                self.index_word[len(self.index_word)] = word

    def texts_to_sequences(self, texts):
        return [[self.word_index.get(word.lower(), 1) for word in text.split()] for text in texts]

    def sequences_to_texts(self, sequences):
        return [' '.join([self.index_word.get(idx, '<UNK>') for idx in sequence]) for sequence in sequences]

def positional_encoding(length, depth):
    positions = np.arange(length)[:, np.newaxis]
    depths = np.arange(depth)[np.newaxis, :] / depth
    angle_rates = 1 / (10000**depths)
    angle_rads = positions * angle_rates
    pos_encoding = np.concatenate([np.sin(angle_rads), np.cos(angle_rads)], axis=-1)
    return tf.cast(pos_encoding, dtype=tf.float32)[:, :depth]

class TransformerLayer(tf.keras.layers.Layer):
    def __init__(self, d_model, num_heads, dff, dropout_rate):
        super(TransformerLayer, self).__init__()
        self.mha = tf.keras.layers.MultiHeadAttention(num_heads, d_model)
        self.ffn = tf.keras.Sequential([
            tf.keras.layers.Dense(dff, activation='relu'),
            tf.keras.layers.Dense(d_model)
        ])
        self.layernorm1 = tf.keras.layers.LayerNormalization(epsilon=1e-6)
        self.layernorm2 = tf.keras.layers.LayerNormalization(epsilon=1e-6)
        self.dropout1 = tf.keras.layers.Dropout(dropout_rate)
        self.dropout2 = tf.keras.layers.Dropout(dropout_rate)

    def call(self, inputs, training):
        attn_output = self.mha(inputs, inputs)
        attn_output = self.dropout1(attn_output, training=training)
        out1 = self.layernorm1(inputs + attn_output)
        ffn_output = self.ffn(out1)
        ffn_output = self.dropout2(ffn_output, training=training)
        return self.layernorm2(out1 + ffn_output)

def build_model():
    inputs = tf.keras.Input(shape=(MAX_SEQUENCE_LENGTH,))
    embedding = tf.keras.layers.Embedding(VOCAB_SIZE, D_MODEL)(inputs)
    
    # Cast the scalar to float16 to match the embedding dtype
    scale = tf.cast(tf.math.sqrt(tf.cast(D_MODEL, tf.float32)), dtype=embedding.dtype)
    embedding *= scale

    pos_encoding = positional_encoding(MAX_SEQUENCE_LENGTH, D_MODEL)
    pos_encoding = tf.cast(pos_encoding, dtype=embedding.dtype)  # Ensure pos_encoding matches embedding dtype
    x = embedding + pos_encoding

    x = tf.keras.layers.Dropout(DROPOUT_RATE)(x)

    for _ in range(NUM_LAYERS):
        x = TransformerLayer(D_MODEL, NUM_HEADS, DFF, DROPOUT_RATE)(x)

    outputs = tf.keras.layers.Dense(VOCAB_SIZE, activation='softmax')(x)
    return tf.keras.Model(inputs=inputs, outputs=outputs)

def load_data(filename):
    questions, answers = [], []
    with open(filename, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f:
        for line in f:
            line = line.strip()
            if line.startswith("(") and line.endswith("),"):
                try:
                    q, a = ast.literal_eval(line[:-1])
                    questions.append(q)
                    answers.append(a)
                except:
                    print(f"Skipping malformed line: {line}")
    return questions, answers

questions, answers = load_data('smalldata.txt')

print(f"Loaded {len(questions)} question-answer pairs")

tokenizer = Tokenizer(VOCAB_SIZE)
tokenizer.fit_on_texts(questions + answers)

questions_seq = tokenizer.texts_to_sequences(questions)
answers_seq = [[tokenizer.word_index['<START>']] + tokenizer.texts_to_sequences([answer])[0] + [tokenizer.word_index['<END>']] for answer in answers]

questions_padded = tf.keras.preprocessing.sequence.pad_sequences(questions_seq, maxlen=MAX_SEQUENCE_LENGTH, padding='post')
answers_padded = tf.keras.preprocessing.sequence.pad_sequences(answers_seq, maxlen=MAX_SEQUENCE_LENGTH + 1, padding='post')

dataset_size = len(questions_padded)
val_size = int(0.1 * dataset_size)
train_size = dataset_size - val_size

train_questions = questions_padded[:train_size]
train_answers = answers_padded[:train_size]
val_questions = questions_padded[train_size:]
val_answers = answers_padded[train_size:]

train_dataset = tf.data.Dataset.from_tensor_slices((train_questions, train_answers[:, :-1], train_answers[:, 1:]))
val_dataset = tf.data.Dataset.from_tensor_slices((val_questions, val_answers[:, :-1], val_answers[:, 1:]))

train_dataset = train_dataset.cache().shuffle(10000).batch(BATCH_SIZE).prefetch(tf.data.AUTOTUNE)
val_dataset = val_dataset.cache().batch(BATCH_SIZE).prefetch(tf.data.AUTOTUNE)

assert len(list(train_dataset)) > 0, "Training dataset is empty!"
assert len(list(val_dataset)) > 0, "Validation dataset is empty!"

model = build_model()

class CustomSchedule(tf.keras.optimizers.schedules.LearningRateSchedule):
    def __init__(self, d_model, warmup_steps=4000):
        super(CustomSchedule, self).__init__()
        self.d_model = tf.cast(d_model, tf.float32)
        self.warmup_steps = warmup_steps

    def __call__(self, step):
        step = tf.cast(step, tf.float32)
        arg1 = tf.math.rsqrt(step)
        arg2 = step * (self.warmup_steps ** -1.5)
        return tf.math.rsqrt(self.d_model) * tf.math.minimum(arg1, arg2)

learning_rate = CustomSchedule(D_MODEL)
optimizer = tf.keras.optimizers.Adam(learning_rate, beta_1=0.9, beta_2=0.98, epsilon=1e-9)

def custom_loss(y_true, y_pred):
    mask = tf.math.logical_not(tf.math.equal(y_true, 0))
    loss_ = tf.keras.losses.sparse_categorical_crossentropy(y_true, y_pred)
    mask = tf.cast(mask, dtype=loss_.dtype)
    loss_ *= mask
    return tf.reduce_sum(loss_)/tf.reduce_sum(mask)

model.compile(optimizer=optimizer, loss=custom_loss, metrics=['accuracy'])

early_stopping = tf.keras.callbacks.EarlyStopping(monitor='val_loss', patience=5, restore_best_weights=True)
reduce_lr = tf.keras.callbacks.ReduceLROnPlateau(monitor='val_loss', factor=0.2, patience=2, min_lr=1e-6)

history = model.fit(
    train_dataset, 
    epochs=EPOCHS, 
    validation_data=val_dataset, 
    callbacks=[early_stopping, reduce_lr]
)

model.save('Solocon30M.h5')

plt.figure(figsize=(12, 6))
plt.plot(history.history['loss'], label='Training Loss')
plt.plot(history.history['val_loss'], label='Validation Loss')
plt.title('Model Loss')
plt.xlabel('Epoch')
plt.ylabel('Loss')
plt.legend()
plt.show()

print("Model training complete.")

def forward(self, hidden_states, inference_params=None):
        """
        hidden_states: (B, L, D)
        Returns: same shape as hidden_states
        """
        batch, seqlen, dim = hidden_states.shape

        conv_state, ssm_state = None, None
        if inference_params is not None:
            conv_state, ssm_state = self._get_states_from_cache(inference_params, batch)
            if inference_params.seqlen_offset > 0:
                # The states are updated inplace
                out, _, _ = self.step(hidden_states, conv_state, ssm_state)
                return out

        # We do matmul and transpose BLH -> HBL at the same time
        xz = rearrange(
            self.in_proj.weight @ rearrange(hidden_states, "b l d -> d (b l)"),
            "d (b l) -> b d l",
            l=seqlen,
        )
        if self.in_proj.bias is not None:
            xz = xz + rearrange(self.in_proj.bias.to(dtype=xz.dtype), "d -> d 1")

        A = -torch.exp(self.A_log.float())  # (d_inner, d_state)
        # In the backward pass we write dx and dz next to each other to avoid torch.cat
        if self.use_fast_path and inference_params is None:  # Doesn't support outputting the states
            if self.bimamba_type == "v3":
                A_b = -torch.exp(self.A_b_log.float())
                out = mamba_inner_fn_no_out_proj(
                    xz,
                    self.conv1d.weight,
                    self.conv1d.bias,
                    self.x_proj.weight,
                    self.dt_proj.weight,
                    A,
                    None,  # input-dependent B
                    None,  # input-dependent C
                    self.D.float(),
                    delta_bias=self.dt_proj.bias.float(),
                    delta_softplus=True,
                )
                out_b = mamba_inner_fn_no_out_proj(
                    xz.flip([-1]),
                    self.conv1d_b.weight,
                    self.conv1d_b.bias,
                    self.x_proj_b.weight,
                    self.dt_proj_b.weight,
                    A_b,
                    None,
                    None,
                    self.D_b.float(),
                    delta_bias=self.dt_proj_b.bias.float(),
                    delta_softplus=True,
                )
                A_s = -torch.exp(self.A_s_log.float())

                xz_s = xz.chunk(self.nslices, dim=-1)
                xz_s = torch.stack(xz_s,dim=-1)
                xz_s = xz_s.flatten(-2)
                out_s = mamba_inner_fn_no_out_proj(
                    xz_s,
                    self.conv1d_s.weight,
                    self.conv1d_s.bias,
                    self.x_proj_s.weight,
                    self.dt_proj_s.weight,
                    A_s,
                    None,
                    None,
                    self.D_s.float(),
                    delta_bias=self.dt_proj_s.bias.float(),
                    delta_softplus=True,
                )

When it is used in the present, it is used in it's root form, when it is used in the preterit past, it is "Tay", and when it is used in the imperfect past, it is "Aktay".
