Work out the number of children.

﻿

Aman is 16th from the left end in a row of boys and Vivek is 18th the from the right end. Gagan is 11th from Aman towards the right and 3rd from Vivek towards the right end. How many boys are there in the row? solve, try again

. 2024 persons stand in a circle looking towards the centre. Then each person turns
towards one of his neighbours by turning 90◦
either left or right. Now exactly 1000
pairs look each other in the eyes. Then everybody turns 180◦
. How many pairs do now
look each other in the eyes?
How many ways are there to seat 3 couples at a round table such that each person does not sit next to his/her spouse?

name: Humorous Anime Crossover Scripts
examples: Write a funny script for Gundam Seed where Kira, Lacus, Athrun, Cagalli, La Flaga, and most importantly Lunamaria confront Shinn about his very... questionable posts that he posted on social media while he was partying in Orb last night, and while Shinn (who is very hungover) doesn't remember much of that, Kira promptly reads out some of the posts that he did, and they are all very inappropiate towards Lunamaria (and as he reads more and more, they get more inappropriate, unfiltered and blunt to a comical level so much that the last post that Kira reads can be literally summed up as "porn" (include it too, with a little bit of interjected euphemisms for comedy purposes and to highlight what things Shinn was saying)), so much that she got very embarassed and comically annoyed (like a tsundere) and called these posts straight up sexual harassment, and then Kira read the final post that Shinn said, and despite Lunamaria trying to interrupt him, he said out loud such a Not Safe For Work post made by Shinn that it really crossed the line, and a comical back and forth erupted between the group and tells La Flaga to shut up because he himself is according to him a MILF addict of some sort, which La Flaga shuts down by saying that he simply likes Ramius a lot, and that he is 28), Shinn finally realizes his mistakes fully, and apologizes and everyone is all good again.

Write a funny script for Gundam Seed where Kira, Lacus, Athrun, Cagalli and La Flaga are on Archangel, and when they enter Shinn's room, they see that he has been taken over by brainrot as he is binge watching Shikanoko Nokonoko Koshitantan on the TV, and while the group finds tat the anime is admittedly funny, Shinn is clearly far into it on a comical level

Write a script for Persona 5 Royal where the Phantom Thieves (including Akechi) are gathered at Leblanc attic, and Morgana is walking in circles, and the group is confused at his behaviour, and suddenly Morgana stops, says "Группа крови на рукаве
Мой порядковый номер на рукаве
Пожелай мне удачи в бою
Пожелай мне
Не остаться в этой траве
Не остаться в этой траве
Пожелай мне удачи
Пожелай мне удачи" (the characters have no clue what the hell this means), and Morgana promptly resumes walking in circles while now also making rhythmical noises, and the group, baffled, figures out the meaning of what he said after some online research, and Morgana returns to normal behavior, which includes simping for Ann

Write a lengthy and funny script for Bocchi the Rock where Hitori tells Nijika,  Ryo and Kita about a "nightmare" that she had that night, and it was one where Kita became an overexaggerated nicotine addict on an absurdly comical level because she wanted to be cool on social media, and while Hitori found that horrifying and nightmarish, to the viewers (and to some degree her friends) it was so absurd that it was funny and comical, including when Hitori told about how Kita somehow convinced them all to try smoking too and how they all ended up unintentionally becoming addicted within their first cigarette, and Hitori being addicted to them too despite coughing a lot when inhaling then and always feeling compulsory need to smoke more, and when the group in "real life" imagined in-dream Hitori smoking and coughing a lot while being addicted, they found it cute in a way (to the dismay of Hitori), as well as how Hitori was really bad with keeping her smoking addiction a secret from her parents and little sister Futari (she is an elementary school student) but she managed to avoid trouble by pure luck or coincedences (have her mention 4 such situations), but worst for Hitori, in-dream Seika found out about all of them smoking and called Hitori's parents and told them about everything, and despite Hitori's parents in real life being very kind and supportive of her, the in-dream parents (and even Futari) had a comically negative reaction to that, and she got comically punished her for smoking

Write a funny script for Gundam Seed where Kira, Lacus, Athrun, Cagalli and La Flaga are on Archangel, and when they enter Shinn's room, they see that he has been taken over by brainrot as he is binge watching Shikanoko Nokonoko Koshitantan on the TV (it's a comedy anime about a schoolgirl Noko who has deer antlers), and while the group finds that the anime is admittedly funny, like when Noko was crossing the street at a street crossing with her friends but she stopped in the middle of the road to stare at the incoming car's headlights (like deers tend to do), Shinn is clearly far into it on a comical level

Write a lengthy script for Gundam Seed where Kira, Lacus, Athrun, Cagalli, La Flaga and Ramius are chatting, when suddenly Lunamaria and Shinn join the group, and suddenly by pure accident, Luna sees something weird in Shinn's browsing history on his phone, and Shinn says that it's just some manga, but she doesn't buy that and after snatching his phone, she finds out that it's a... certain kind of website with manga made for... adults... and then she noticed what Shinn was reading there, and it was a doujin about Shinn and Lunamaria doing... adult stuff, and Luna promptly exploded at him with overexaggerated tsundere rage (and all kinds of adjectives like pervert, idiot and more), and initially it amuses the group, but then Luna dives deeper into what Shinn was browsing, and she finds out that he read... adult content doujins about Cagalli and Athrun too, about Lacus doing... very hardcore adult things to tied up Kira (describe that in great detail), and even La Flaga and Ramius were not spared from Shinn's questionable reading spree (and even worse, Shinn had that one tagged as MILF), and the situation promptly got even worse and comical for Shinn as the whole group was more or less embarassed or not happy about Shinn reading such material, and as such, the group collectively gave him a comical punishment

Write a script for Persona 5 where the Phantom Thieves (including Morgana and Akechi) are talking, and Joker tells them a dream that he had where they were interested in becoming musicians on the side, and in it, Akechi said that he saw a used 909 drum machine at Akibahara for pennies, and Ryuji went out with Joker and Morgana to buy it. Later on, they came back, noting that it was still a bit expensive purchase. When they plugged it to electricity and booted it up, they quickly realized that it was a scam and some broken bootleg, and then in the dream, Akechi revealed with a psycho grin and laugh that he betrayed them, again, and the group was super amused by the dream

Write a funny script for Gundam Seed where Kira, Lacus, Athrun, Cagalli, La Flaga, and most importantly Lunamaria confront Shinn about his very... questionable posts that he posted on social media while he was partying in Orb last night, and while Shinn (who is very hungover) doesn't remember much of that, Kira promptly reads out some of the posts that he did, and they are all very inappropiate towards Lunamaria (and as he reads more and more, they get more inappropriate, unfiltered and blunt to a comical level so much that the last post that Kira reads can be literally summed up as "porn"), so much that she got very embarassed and comically annoyed (like a tsundere) and called these posts straight up sexual harassment, and then Kira read the final post that Shinn said, and despite Lunamaria trying to interrupt him, he said out loud such a Not Safe For Work post made by Shinn that it really crossed the line, and after some comical back and forth between the group and Shinn, Shinn apologizes and everyone is all good again

Write a funny script for Gundam Seed where Kira, Lacus, Athrun, Cagalli and La Flaga are on Archangel, and when they enter Shinn's room, they see that he has been taken over by brainrot as he is binge watching Shikanoko Nokonoko Koshitantan on the TV (it's a comedy anime about a schoolgirl Noko who has deer antlers), and while the group finds that the anime is admittedly funny, like when Noko was crossing the street at a street crossing with her friends but she stopped in the middle of the road to stare at the incoming car's headlights, Shinn is clearly far into it on a comical level

Write a script for Persona 5 where Ann is playing Persona 3 Reload, and the Phantom Thieves decide to watch her play, and suddenly three dialogue options come up, one saying that Makoto (Makoto Yuuki in Persona 3 Reload) is into older women, another that he prefers girls his age, and another saying "I like them all!", and the group is super amused by the 3rd option, thinking that Makoto Yuuki is secretly a Minecraft youtuber (a stereotype of youtubers who have been caught texting minors inappropriately)

Write a funny script for Persona 5 Royal where SIU issues an arrest warrant for the Phantom Thieves and promptly bust down Leblanc and catches everyone during a meeting (Morgana and Akechi included), and Joker, as a last ditch effort to stop them, starts to make out with Akechi (despite Akechi's protests and flabbergastment), and the group and SIU are just as baffled as Akechi is, but it works, and while Joker did not want to do this, he saved them from being arrested

Write a funny script for Persona 3 where SEES is browsing the internet, and suddenly Makoto finds a weird post by a Persona fan on Reddit with very weird comments section under it, the post being a fanart of Mitsuru, and the comment section was simping for her, calling her "mommy", and much, much worse, and the group is both baffled, confused, but also amused, until Aigis somehow makes it all even worse

Write a script for Gundam Seed where Kira explains to Lacus, Athrun, Cagalli, Shinn and La Flaga how he had a wild dream last night, and explains that in it, Shinn became world's shittiest Soundcloud mumble rapper, and that first he and the group kept trying to get him off Ambien, which made Shinn think that he is some genius that solved universe, even though what he was saying was abstractively nonsensical (and he gave several examples of such nonsense, like "Quantum science" when all it was was just a lamp shoved into the toilet by Shinn), then they tried to get him off lean and percs, and then they tried to get him off of what in dream Shinn described as fentanyl-supercharged Kawasaki Ninja H2 bike, which Kiea doesn't even understand what that was even supposed to mean, though he felt sorry for such a cool bike, and the group found the dream amusing, and they made fun of Shinn in a lighthearted way

Write a funny script for Bocchi the Rock where Hitori tells Nijika,  Ryo and Kita about a "nightmare" that she had that night, and it was one where Kita became an overexaggerated nicotine addict on an absurdly comical level, and while Hitori found that horrifying and nightmarish, to the viewers (and to some degree her friends) it was so absurd that it was funny and comical, including when Hitori told about in-dream Kita's ludicrous and comical nicotine withdrawals when the group threw her cigarettes away and much more

Write a funny script where Nendoroids of Joker from Persona 5, Hori and Miyamura from Horimiya, and plushies of Kira from Gundam Seed and Morgana from Persona 5 open a new box in my room (they live in my room), and they see Jack Frost from Persona 5 (in the form of a plushie). They prompty try to greet him, but Morgana does a mediocre and unfunny joke about him, and Jack Frost promptly insults him by saying that he "hees" on Morgana's "hoe", which amuses the group and angers Morgana a lot as he wrongly thinks that he refers to Ann (Morgana simps for her a lot), and when Morgana tries to talk back at him, Jack Frost starts to issue post-ironic death and criminal threats at him, which amuses the group

Write a script for Persona 5 Royal where the Phantom Thieves (including Akechi) are gathered at Leblanc attic, and Morgana is walking in circles, and the group is confused at his behaviour, and suddenly Morgana stops, says "Снова за окнами белый день
День вызывает меня на бой
Я чувствую, закрывая глаза
Весь мир идёт на меня войной" (the characters have no clue what the hell this means), and Morgana promptly resumes walking in circles while now also making rhythmical noises, and the group, baffled, figures out the meaning of what he said after some online research, and Morgana returns to normal behavior, which includes simping for Ann

Write a funny script for Gundam Seed where Shinn is bored, when suddenly he come up with a prank, and he promptly announces it to Kira, Lacus, Athrun and Cagalli. The prank is that he recently played Persona 3 Reload and he enjoyed the game thoroughly, and so he will send a gift to Yzak, that being a body pillow with suggestive picture of Makoto Yuuki on it, and the group is amused by the idea. Later on, Yzak unboxes the mystery box in front of Dearka and Le Creuset, and when they see the contents looking like he clearly ordered them for himself, and Yzak gets mortified and furious, while Dearka and Le Creuset are amused, and later on, Shinn receives a message full of fury and expletives directed at him and his mother, explaining to Shinn that now Dearka and Le Creuset think he is gay, all with caps lock key stuck on, and he and the group are amused by it

Write a script for Gundam Seed where Kira, Athrun, Lacus, Cagalli, La Flaga and Ramius are in Archangel's cafeteria chatting, and Lacus is trying playing a new singleplayer video game that she just bought on Steam on her laptop, when she realizes that she cannot launch the game because Denuvo servers are down, and hearing that Lacus is sad because she can't play her game, Kira promptly steps in, and using his Coordinator skills downloads x64dbg onto her laptop and in 30 minutes he removes Denuvo DRM from the game (with a bit of help from Athrun), and Lacus is now happy that she can play the game, which makes Kira very happy, and the group impressed, but then Le Creuset and Yzak appear out of nowhere and without a sensical explanation as to how they are on Archangel, and promptly announce to Kira and Athrun that they just broke the law for breaking DRM and for commiting an act of Piracy, that they are reporting them to respective copyright holders and police, and that they will rot in jail, all while saying that in a comically cartoonishly villanous tone and a sprinkle of comical "leave the multi billion dollar corporation alone" kind of bootlicking vibe

Write a funny script for Gundam Seed where Kira, Lacus, Athrun, Cagalli and La Flaga are on Archangel's cafeteria, and Lacus tells Kira and Athrun a problem with one of her Haros (which he is holding in her hand), and that it's behaving weirdly, and suddenly another Haro belonging to her flies into the cafeteria and it is comically angry at something, and suddenly the Haro that Lacus was holding gets angry at the other Haro, and after some comical back and forth between the Haros, they begin to fight (read: bump into eachother all over the cafeteria), and when Lacus sternly tells them to stop as she does not support violence, the Haros get even more enraged, and they promptly start to "attack" Shinn who by pure coincedence just entered the cafeteria with Lunamaria, and the entire ordeal is very funny

Write a script for Persona 5 where Ann is playing Persona 3 Reload, and the Phantom Thieves decide to watch her play, and suddenly three dialogue options come up, one saying that Makoto (Makoto Yuuki in Persona 3 Reload) is into older women, another that he prefers girls his age, and another saying "I like them all!", and the group is super amused by the 3rd option, thinking that Makoto Yuuki is secretly a Minecraft youtuber or Dr. Disrespect (first is a stereotype of youtubers who have been caught texting minors inappropriately, and Dr. Disrespect was exposed for the same thing recently)

Answers are submitted by wrapping the answer in d.answer(). 
Answers should ideally be one liners, however if you need to call d.data() twice, that can be on a separate line like below:
data = d.data(85)
Imports can also be on their own lines. Everything else should be within d.answer()

Question 85:
Read /home/student/Public/packets/web.pcap  Commands are embedded in the packet payloads between the 
tags <command> and </command>.  The .data() method will give you a command number.  Submit that command 
as a string as the answer.  For example if .data() is a 5 you submit the 5th command that was 
transmitted.  Ignore blank commands (ie <command></command>).

digits. Submit a list of SSNs in the order they appear in the data. All your SSNs should be in the 
format XXX-XX-XXXX

ranges expanded. Example "string",9,7,4-6,"apple" becomes "string",9,7,4,5,6,"apple". Submit a single 
string containing all the expanded entries.

Question 62:
You have determined that a stream encryption cipher is using repeating keys. You XORed together two 
pieces of encrypted data which has the effect of eliminating the keys.  However the remaining data is 
still not clear text. Instead it is the two pieces of original clear text data XORed together.  IE  
(Data1 XOR key1) XOR (Data2 XOR key1) = (Data1 XOR Data2). The Data element contains a list of two 
strings. The first one is the encrypted data (Data1 XOR Data2). The second one is some known clear text 
from either Data1 or Data2. XOR the first string (Encrypted data) with the second string (clear text 
Data1 or Data2) to determine the other clear text data and submit the unencrypted string.

contain that string.  The answer is a sorted list of all of the absolute paths to files that contain the
string.  Do not decompress gzip files.

The following is some test data:


The data element contains a string from a mysterious programming language. In this language variable 
names begin with an uppercase letter and end with the same uppercase letter. For example in this line: 
ZAxuZAuA there are two variables ZAxuZ and AuA. Notice that there is a capital A inside the variable 
ZAxuZ but it is not the start of a new variable because it is part of another variable. To make things 
more complex a variable name may contain the same uppercase letter than begins and ends the variable 
name if it is escaped with a 0. So the line ZAp0ZuZAuX0AZA contains the variables ZAp0ZuZ and AuX0AZA.  
Create a regular expression to parse the line of code and extract all the variable names.

Question 108:

Binary numbers are base2. You can represent any numbers with just two numbers, a zero and a one. For 
example binary 0010 is a decimal 2. Python easily converts between binary and decimal. The bin() 
function converts decimal numbers to binary. For example, bin(10) will produce 0b1010. That is a 1 in 
the 3rd position and a 1 in the 1st position. So it 2**3 plus 2**1 or 8+2 which is 10. Now imagine that 
instead of zero and one we used other characters. If instead of the characters '0' and '1' we used the 
characters '$' and 'o' respectively. The decimal 10 would be 'o$o$'. The data element will contain a 
string with two parts separated by a comma. The first part has two characters that represent the base 2 
values. Convert the number to decimal and submit the number. For example, if data is '!*,*!!*!' the 
answer is 18.

the payload of the streams in timestamped order followed by the value from .data().  Submit that as the 
answer.

Environmental laws have grown significantly over the last 10-20 years. Everyone agrees we need to protect our environment and punish those who do not. But how far do we go? The laws swing back and forth in the level of restrictions from fairly aggressive to more balanced on environment versus commercial to fairly pro-business. 

One of my "pet-peeves" is today's throw away world thanks to cheap goods from overseas. I support the economic model of international business and driving costs down, but there must be limits. A generation ago, when you purchased an appliance such as a refrigerator, or a tv, it was a major purchase that you intended to keep for 10-30 years. We have driven prices down and today make such quick advancements in technology that we all want new. But there is no though process given on where does the old go? I suggest that we need stronger environmental laws to help this where the laws (1) force manufacturers to maintain replacement parts for 10 years after purchase, (2) make those parts economical, and (3) most importantly all such appliances and tvs must have an upfront 20% of their cost recycle fee collected at the time of original purchase that is mostly refunded (say 1/2 of the amount or 10% with the rest going to pay for the program and recycle needs) at a proper approved disposal site to assure proper recycling occurs. Think about how many tube tvs fill are landfills today because no one wants them (even though many still operate). If you do not know what a tube tv is, ask your parents. What do you think of my proposed law?

"Global climate change is one of the most pressing issues of our time. It is driven by the increase in greenhouse gases such as carbon dioxide and methane, largely due to human activities like burning fossil fuels, deforestation, and industrial processes. The impacts of climate change are widespread and include more frequent and severe weather events, rising sea levels, and disruptions to ecosystems and agriculture. Addressing this challenge requires coordinated efforts at international, national, and local levels, with a focus on reducing emissions, transitioning to renewable energy sources, and protecting natural habitats."

Look at the Earth from space. Why does our planet look so blue? Its blue because water covers almost three quarters of the Earth's surface. Water is not just an important part of our planet. It is an important part of our body, too. More than half of our total body 
weight is water. 

Our body loses water whenever we exercise or go to the toilet. That's why we need to drink plenty of water every day. We drink water. We use it to cook, clean, and carry waste out of our homes. Farmers use it to grow vegetables and crops like rice and corn; factories use it to make products. 

Since the 1950s, the amount（数量）of water people use has increased by three times. But the water supply（供应）hasn't. Scientists worry that soon there won't be enough water for us, as well 
as for the animals and plants that share our world. What can we do to help? Use water wisely. 

Having enough water isn't our only problem. We also need it clean. 

Right now, ships and factories are putting wastes into seas, rivers and so on. Even chemicals that farmers use are running into rivers and lakes. All this pollution can make the water dangerous to drink. It can also harm fish and other water-living lives. 

We must do something to stop pollution. It's the best way to protect our world's most valuable 
natural resource（资源）.

Добавь ошибок и опечаток, будто это писал человек

Water pollution, affecting rivers, lakes, and seas, is a critical issue for environmentalists worldwide. There are several causes of this problem, and its effects on both animal life and human society are profound.

One of the primary causes of water pollution is industrial waste. Factories often discharge untreated chemicals and heavy metals into water bodies, which can be highly toxic. Another significant factor is agricultural runoff. Fertilizers and pesticides used in farming can wash into rivers and lakes, leading to nutrient overload and algal blooms. Domestic waste, including sewage and litter, also contributes to the problem, especially in areas with inadequate sanitation systems.

The consequences of water pollution are far-reaching. For animal life, polluted water can lead to habitat destruction and a decrease in biodiversity. Many species, including fish and birds, suffer from diseases caused by toxic substances. Moreover, some pollutants can accumulate in the food chain, posing risks to top predators, including humans.

In human society, water pollution affects health and economy. Contaminated water sources can lead to waterborne diseases, such as cholera and typhoid, affecting millions worldwide. Economically, polluted water can damage industries that rely on clean water, such as fishing and tourism. Additionally, the cost of treating polluted water for human consumption is substantial.

In conclusion, water pollution is a serious environmental issue caused by industrial waste, agricultural runoff, and domestic waste. Its effects on animal life and human society are severe, impacting health, biodiversity, and economies. Addressing this problem requires concerted efforts from governments, industries, and individuals to reduce pollution and protect our water resources. какие ты добавил опечатки?

Environmental laws have grown significantly over the last 10-20 years. Everyone agrees we need to protect our environment and punish those who do not. But how far do we go? The laws swing back and forth in the level of restrictions from fairly aggressive to more balanced on environment versus commercial to fairly pro-business. 

One of my "pet-peeves" is today's throw away world thanks to cheap goods from overseas. I support the economic model of international business and driving costs down, but there must be limits. A generation ago, when you purchased an appliance such as a refrigerator, or a tv, it was a major purchase that you intended to keep for 10-30 years. We have driven prices down and today make such quick advancements in technology that we all want new. But there is no though process given on where does the old go? I suggest that we need stronger environmental laws to help this where the laws (1) force manufacturers to maintain replacement parts for 10 years after purchase, (2) make those parts economical, and (3) most importantly all such appliances and tvs must have an upfront 20% of their cost recycle fee collected at the time of original purchase that is mostly refunded (say 1/2 of the amount or 10% with the rest going to pay for the program and recycle needs) at a proper approved disposal site to assure proper recycling occurs. How can we save the earth

The world's natural resources are being used at an alarming rate - not only fossil fuels such as coal, oil, and gas, but also water, wood, metals, and minerals. This has many potential consequences for the billions of people who live on Earth. In recent years, both individuals and governments have become more interested in better managing the world's resources. While alternative energy solutions are important, they are not always feasible. An immediate way to improve the situation is to encourage everyone to "reduce, reuse, recycle."
We must all learn to use fewer natural resources on a day-to-day basis. We can start by reducing the number of electrical items we leave plugged in, using less water, and avoiding motorized transportation. Many cities are instigating carbon emissions taxes, which is a step in the right direction. In our homes, we can use only energy-saving light bulbs and install water meters. Parents need to train children from an early age to turn off lights that they are not using. It is sometimes difficult to persuade people to use less energy and water, or to eat less food, but an effective way to motivate people to adopt less-wasteful practices is to make these essential commodities much more expensive.
It is often possible to restore old, unwanted objects to a state in which they can be used again. Glass bottles can be cleaned and reused without having to be broken and remade. Reusing things is a very efficient process and consumes less energy than recycling. It does, however, often require a lot of expensive organization and administration. There are also concerns to address regarding reused medical equipment and food-storage items, for example, because of safety and hygiene issues. Still, the benefits of reusing items are clear.
Most of us know that materials such as paper and plastic can be recycled into new products. This process uses less energy and emits fewer greenhouse gases than producing articles from raw materials. Yes, sorting through used materials before recycling them is a dirty and difficult job, and breaking up electronic equipment to recycle rare metals is time-consuming and potentially dangerous. But provided we understand the dangers involved, the necessity of recycling on a community scale is evident.
A lot of attention has been paid in recent years to the dangers of relying on fossil fuels. For this reason, the use of alternatives to coal, oil, and gas is becoming more and more common. Alternative energy sources can be recovered or produced without emitting carbon dioxide and contributing to global warming. They can decrease air pollution, which is better for our health, as it diminishes instances of asthma. They are often sustainable resources as well, which means they will not get used up.
There are many examples of alternative energy sources. Hydropower utilizes the power of moving water such as waterfalls and rivers. Large turbines can be used to generate wind power. Solar energy uses panels that absorb sunlight and turn it into electricity by way of photovoltaic cells. The burning of biomass can be used to create steam. Finally, geothermal energy uses the heat within the earth to produce electricity and heat buildings.
A particular type of alternative energy may work the best for a particular region. The other side of this is that some of these energy sources may not be available at all to people in certain places because of environmental limitations.
To avoid a catastrophic depletion of vital natural resources in the future, urgent action is required now. Alternative energy production is certainly essential, but it can be expensive and time-consuming to install the required elements. Some developing areas of the world may simply be unable to pay for it. In other places, corporations and taxpayers may be resistant to it. The "reduce, reuse, recycle" strategy, at least for the present, seems to be a manageable one that can be practiced by both individuals and organizations. People may be resistant to the idea of changing their ways or increasing the cost of their routines by "going green," but it is crucial that we do this for the future of the planet. 이 지문을 문단별로 한글과 영어를 섞어서 요약 및 구조화 해줘
